description:
[LiteLLM](https://www.litellm.ai/) is a lightweight, open-source proxy and analytics layer for large language model (LLM) APIs. It enables unified access, observability, and cost control across multiple LLM providers.

This dashboard provides a comprehensive, real-time view of all LLM API activity flowing through the LiteLLM proxy layer. It is designed to help teams monitor performance, track key usage metrics, detect anomalies, and manage costs across multiple large language model providers.

**Further reading:**

- [Datadog LiteLLM Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/litellm/)
- [LiteLLM Docs](https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/)
- [LiteLLM Monitoring Docs](https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/proxy/prometheus)
title: LiteLLM Overview

definition.content:
[LiteLLM](https://www.litellm.ai/) is a lightweight, open-source proxy and analytics layer for large language model (LLM) APIs. It enables unified access, observability, and cost control across multiple LLM providers.

This dashboard provides a comprehensive, real-time view of all LLM API activity flowing through the LiteLLM proxy layer. It is designed to help teams monitor performance, track key usage metrics, detect anomalies, and manage costs across multiple large language model providers.

In addition to the native integration, use Datadog's LLM Observability to evaluate, troubleshoot, and iterate on your LLM agents or applications using LiteLLM. LLM Observability SDK can __[automatically trace](https://docs.datadoghq.com/llm_observability/instrumentation/auto_instrumentation?tab=python)__ your LLM operations. __[Get started today.](https://docs.datadoghq.com/llm_observability/quickstart/?tab=python)__

**Further reading:**

- [Datadog LiteLLM Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/litellm/)
- [LiteLLM Docs](https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/)
- [LiteLLM Monitoring Docs](https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/proxy/prometheus)
- [Get started with LiteLLM and Datadog LLM Observability](https://docs.datadoghq.com/llm_observability/instrumentation/auto_instrumentation/?tab=python#litellm)
LiteLLM Overview show a quick summary of all reporting LiteLLM instances and related monitors and their status.
Checks the health of all configured LLMs by calling their APIs via the `/health` proxy endpoint.
Displays usage, budget, and rate limit metrics across users, teams, and virtual API keys to monitor spend, token consumption, and resource limits.

definition.title: Time Until API Key Budget Reset
Remaining API Key Request per Model
Remaining API Key Token per Model

definition.content: Shows overall LiteLLM Proxy usage by tracking total and failed client-side requests, providing insight into traffic volume and reliability across users, teams, and keys.
Monitors LLM provider performance by tracking API call success/failure rates, rate/token limits, deployment health, latency, and fallback events across models, keys, and teams.

formulas.alias: Avg API Time to First Token

definition.title: Average LLM API Time to First Token

definition.content: Monitors the health and performance of LiteLLM and its adjacent services by tracking Redis/Postgres call latency and failures, as well as overall LiteLLM API call latency.

Provides visibility into the health of the DB Transaction Queue by tracking which pod holds the DB write lock and monitoring the size of in-memory and Redis spend update queues for users, teams, and keys.

Enables logging of all successful and failed LLM calls, as well as system service metrics, to Datadog for observability and monitoring. [More info here](https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/observability/datadog).

[Datadog LLM Observability](https://docs.datadoghq.com/llm_observability/quickstart/?tab=python) enables you to experiment, troubleshoot, monitor, and evaluate LLM agents or applications. Get real-time visibility into inputs and outputs, errors, latency, token usage, and more, along with in-depth quality and security checks at every stage, including data retrieval, tool calls, and agent interactions.

LLM Observability SDK can [automatically trace](https://docs.datadoghq.com/llm_observability/instrumentation/auto_instrumentation?tab=python) your LLM operations. Datadog's LLM Observability views integrate with LiteLLM metrics to provide visibility into your workflows.

For setup instructions and auto-instrumentation, check out the [LLM Observability Quickstart Guide](https://docs.datadoghq.com/llm_observability/quickstart/?tab=python).

To explore model-level usage, token attribution, cost analysis, and request tracing across teams and providers, visit the [LLM Observability dashboard](https://app.datadoghq.com/dash/integration/llm_operational_insights).

custom_links.label: View related spans in LLM Observability
